case_vignette: A 33-year-old man comes to the emergency department because of repeated episodes of severe headache for the past 3 days. He is currently having his 2nd episode of the day. He usually has his first episode in the mornings. The pain is severe and localized to his right forehead and right eye. He had similar symptoms last summer. He works as an analyst for a large hedge fund management company and spends the majority of his time at the computer. He has been under a lot of stress because of overdue paperwork. He also has chronic shoulder pain. He has been using indomethacin every 6 hours for the pain but has had no relief. He has smoked one pack of cigarettes daily for 15 years. He appears restless. Vital signs are within normal limits. Physical examination shows drooping of the right eyelid, tearing of the right eye, and rhinorrhea. The right pupil is 2 mm and the left pupil is 4 mm. There is localized tenderness to his right supraspinatus muscle. The remainder of the examination shows no abnormalities.
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?

Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've been having repeated severe headaches for the past 3 days, including one right now, and they mostly hit me in the mornings on my right forehead and right eye.
Could you tell me your age and sex?
I'm a 33-year-old man.
Do you have any medical history of illnesses or take any medications?
I had similar headache symptoms last summer, and I've been taking indomethacin every 6 hours for my shoulder pain, but it hasn't helped.
Do you have any family history of medical conditions, specifically related to headaches or neurological disorders?
I haven't mentioned any family history of medical conditions.
I see. Have you experienced any changes in your vision, such as blurriness or sensitivity to light, during these headaches?
No, I haven't mentioned any changes in my vision like blurriness or sensitivity to light.
**Final Diagnosis:** Cluster Headaches
